main event: A witness spotted an orange, teardrop-shaped object in the sky over East Prairie, Missouri in 1956.
interesting points: The object was about 8 times the size of the witness's fist.
The underside of the object was orange in color.
The object was observed for about 3 minutes.
The object's trajectory was a straight track and it passed out of sight.
The case was investigated by the U.S. Air Force and classified as either a balloon or possibly an aircraft.
